title: The Descent from the Cross
description: Het lichaam van Christus wordt van het kruis gehaald. Onderaan het kruis is Maria flauwgevallen. Op de achtergrond een landschap.

principalMakers.name: Ugo da Carpi
principalMakers.labelDesc: mentioned on object Ugo da Carpi, Italy

iconClassDescription: Christ is taken down from the cross (one arm of Christ still nailed to the cross)
stadsgezichten en landschappen met bouwsels van mensen

longTitle: The Descent from the Cross, Ugo da Carpi, c. 1518
subTitle: h 337mm × w 282mm
scLabelLine: The Descent from the Cross, Ugo da Carpi (1450-1525), after Raphael (1483-1520), chiaroscuro woodcut printed in black and two shades of blue, c. 1517–1518

label.title: The Descent from the Cross
label.makerLine: The Descent from the Cross, Ugo da Carpi (1450-1525), after Raphael (1483-1520), chiaroscuro woodcut printed in black and two shades of blue, c. 1517–1518
label.description: The German invention of the colour woodcut caught on in Italy. Ugo da Carpi was the first to use this technique there. The Descent from the Cross after a design by Raphael is one of his earliest prints. The printmaker used two rather than one tone block: one for the light blue sections, and the other for the dark blue shadows.
